game_description: Ultrawings is back and it's bigger and better than ever! Return to the skies in 5 all-new aircraft as you complete hundreds of missions across a beautifully stylized, island-themed world! MOTION CONTROLS! Our ground-breaking motion control system returns! Use your virtual hands to fully interact and control your aircraft. TONS OF GAMEPLAY! You'll be unlocking new gameplay throughout the 40 - 60 hour game! One minute you'll be dogfighting enemy bogies in a WW2-era warplane and the next you'll be popping balloons with a dart pistol in the Ultralight. Up to 8-players online multiplayer too! FEATURES -- Pilot 5 unique aircraft (including a helicopter!) using your virtual hands for an incredibly immersive experience! -- Explore all-new, hand-crafted islands. Each island is about 3x larger than the ones in Ultrawings! -- The world is teeming with life! -- Fly during day, night, dusk, and overcast conditions. -- 8-player multiplayer! Welcome back to Ultrawings, Pilot!
Languages: English, Chinese (China), French (France), German, Italian, Japanese, Korean, Spanish (Spain)
review_1: I almost never play my other games. The feel is perfect and i have so much fun doing all the challenges. The difficulty progression is very well done and when i get stuck i can just hop in a different plane and do challenges over there. I also like what they did with the limited graphics capability of the quest2. They went with like a mario 64 type of look which is very fun and looks great. Would love if they added a co op mode and passenger / instructor and trainee mode
review_2: Lots of great games out there but for my money, after you've been standing for hours playing Beat Saber or Pavlov, best game to play sitting down is Ultra Wings 2... big baby! That'd what we used to say at my school to get it hype... aaaanyway. Yeah it's so fun. It's more fun when you don't buy infinite gas and ammo.
review_3: There's an annoying bug that won't let me interact with the plane's engine start toggle. All the other switches and levers produce haptic feedback when your hand gets near it but no such feedback happens near the engine start. No matter what I do, I can't get my finger to point. I've physically pointed making sure I'm not touching the trigger with my actual hand and the vr hand remains useless. I've confirmed the capacitative touch on the trigger is working because in the Quest menu, my virtual hands respond as I take my finger off and on the trigger. Tried deleting and reinstalling the app, but that lost all my progress and I don't feel like re-doing the challenges I've already beat. It was fun while it worked, but definitely wasn't worth paying for. You win some, you lose some, glad it wasn't more expensive.
